description: Index of primes where largest gap occurs.
references: H. Riesel, Prime numbers and computer methods for factorization, Progress in Mathematics, Vol. 57, Birkhauser, Boston, 1985, Chap. 4, see pp. 381-384.
N. J. A. Sloane and Simon Plouffe, The Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences, Academic Press, 1995 (includes this sequence).
links: Charles R Greathouse IV, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..75
Jens Kruse Andersen, The Top-20 Prime Gaps
Jens Kruse Andersen, New record prime gap
Alexei Kourbatov, Tables of record gaps between prime constellations, arXiv preprint arXiv:1309.4053, 2013.
J. Young and A. Potler, First occurrence prime gaps, Math. Comp., 52 (1989), 221-224.
Index entries for primes, gaps between
mathematica: f[n_] := Block[{d, i, m = 0}, Reap@ For[i = 1, i <= n, i++, d = Prime[i + 1] - Prime@ i; If[d > m, m = d; Sow@ i, False]] // Flatten // Rest]; f@ 1000000 (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Mar 24 2015 *)
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
